record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that we move to morning business and that the first person recognized be Senator Sanders, who is always very patient.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I would just concur, if I might, with the fine words of Senator Reid. I have not known Senator Warner all that long, but clearly he is what a Senator should be. He is thoughtful, intelligent, and respectful of other points of view. While he and I may not agree on every issue, I have appreciated working with him, and I applaud him for his service to this country.
I thank my colleague for his remarks.

Mr. President, I did want to say a word or two on the Defense authorization bill and to indicate that my staff has been working with the staff of Senators LEVIN and WARNER. I hope we can work out an agreement on an important amendment I have authored along with Senators FEINGOLD and WHITEHOUSE.
